Text:
On a day after the Shadow Garden returned　from
investigating the Sanctuary...

The materials the team brought back with them are
delivered to Eta, who begins her analytical
investigation.

—Investigative report No. 004, the Tears of Diablos.
A red liquid created from the cells of Diablos...

—Those who ingest this liquid gain vast power and an
eternally youthful body...

—Though the Tears have no side effects, periodical
inoculation is required, and they can only be
produced in limited quantities...

—*sigh* A collection of answers...that I already
know... I was aware this would be the case, but it's
still...disappointing...

And this data... Is it recent? Is this all they can
deduce...even with modern technology?

If the Tears are imperfect...then why do they
continue to use them?
*sigh* Incomprehensible...

I would never permit that... It's a desecration of
science...

Urgh... When I get like this...the only cure is the
nutritional supplement "Calorie Made"!
*chomp*...*munch, munch*...
—Whoa, looks like someone's in a mood.

Eta turns at the sound of the voice behind her to
see Zeta standing in the doorway of the lab.
...*munch* Zeta? What...do you want?

Ugh, at least swallow your food before you talk...
I brought some more documents by, but am I
interrupting something?
...*gulp* Not really...

The door was wide open so I just let myself in.
Anyway, here you go.
...Just set them...over there.
So, on top of this pile of papers?
Sure...

Gotta say, it's a rare thing to see you showing any
sort of emotion. Is the report getting to you?
Zeta points at the materials in Eta's hand.
Well...you could say that...

There...wasn't much new information... More like
a compilation of our previous findings.

But...shouldn't we also be happy that it proves our
intel work was on-point?

That's how the organization would see it...
But I couldn't care less...

I'm a scientist... For me...ignorance is shame...
I exist to make the impossible, possible...
...You're really fired up today, huh?

I...always am... But the problem is...this report on
the Tears of Diablos...
This...should be a simple task for me, and yet...

Hmm... I'm guessing that you're irked because it has
imperfections?
Well... Yes...

The mere mention of the topic causes Eta's face to
take on an extremely irritated expression.

...Gotcha. I think I have a good idea of what makes
you tick now.

So what is it you want to do? Create a perfected
version of the Tears of Diablos?

I don't know... But formulating an elixir for eternal
youth...doesn't sound so bad...

But you don't get to make the call on your own when
it comes to stuff of that level. Not to mention that
you'd also need royal blood and Diablos cells.
Urgh... Maybe if I asked Gamma...
They don't sell that stuff at Mitsugoshi, you know.
Grrr... But maybe with enough money...

...Money isn't going to solve this. Besides, your
research is meant to serve the Garden, and Gamma
already funds it with her earnings anyway.
...Tch.
Um, did you just click your tongue at me?
Just your imagination...

Look at it this way—it's possible the Cult had their
own set of troubles. Like with resources or
interpersonal relationships.

I mean, the Knights of Rounds has 12 members.
Making a miracle youth pill that satisfies the
greed of that many puffed-up toads at once
is a pipe dream.

Zeta... Are there any bases...we haven't
investigated?

Bases we haven't investigated? Well, there are
several locations I uncovered while on infiltration
ops. I haven't reported some of them.
Haven't reported? You're...concealing information?
Hey now, let's not describe it like that.

I'm not concealing anything—I just convey my intel on
a need-to-know basis. Which is all the better since
dubious info could sow chaos in the Garden.
If you have any leads...tell me.
Why?

Imperfection...is unacceptable... And the debased
scientists at fault...must be punished...

Eta... I can't say I've ever seen you this interested
in the Cult.

I'm trying to think if I found anything that'd tickle
your fancy... Hmm...

Eta's expression remains uncharacteristically serious
as Zeta tries to recall some relevant information.

Now that you mention it, there was a place that
seemed like an old research facility in a city kinda
far from here.
A research facility? One of the Cult's?

Possibly. I poked around inside a bit, and there's no
doubt it was being used for some kind of research.
But I didn't see any signs of recent activity, so they
must've abandoned it for some reason.
And this..."city kinda far from here"...is?
...The college town, Laugus.

The college town...Laugus... The Cult's reach extends
that far?

This is just a hunch, but after what we saw at the
Sanctuary, I think it's safe to say that almost
nowhere is free from the Cult's influence.

If a place seems suspicious, then we'd do well to
treat it as such.

Besides, it'd be even more strange to not suspect
anything with it being so close to the
stomping ground of so many smart people.

...Oh, but not to say they're anywhere near as smart
as you, Eta.

Zeta quickly tacks this last part on, sensing that
calling the Cult "smart" might upset Eta, given her
current mood.
...Naturally.

Anyways, I'll prioritize investigating the facility
in Laugus. I'll put in a request with Lady Alpha,
so I'm sure in good time she'll put together a
team to—
—I'm going myself this time!
...Huh?
Eta suddenly ensnares Zeta with a tendril of slime.
H-Hey?! Eta?!

I can't...wait... You're the only one...who knows
the location...so you'll show me...the way...

O-Okay, okay! Just let me go! It's a bit of a trip,
so we'll need to make some basic preparations!
Got it?! I won't try to run!

Zeta eventually manages to get Eta to put her down
and then makes ready for their distant investigation.
The two then set off for the supposed research
facility in Laugus.
